columns.School_ID: A unique identifier assigned to each university in the database.
columns.Location: The geographical location of the university, typically including the city and state.
columns.Founded: The year the university was established.
columns.Affiliation: The type of institution, indicating whether it is public or private.
columns.Enrollment: The total number of students enrolled at the university.
columns.Nickname: The official nickname or mascot of the university's sports teams.
columns.Primary_conference: The main athletic conference in which the university competes.

university.table_description: The university table contains information about various universities including identifiers, names, locations, founding years, affiliations, student enrollment numbers, team nicknames, and primary athletic conference memberships.

columns.Team_ID: A unique identifier for each basketball team.
columns.School_ID: A reference identifier linking the team to its respective university.
columns.Team_Name: The name of the basketball team.
columns.ACC_Regular_Season: The team's record during the regular season in the Atlantic Coast Conference (ACC), represented in wins-losses format.
columns.ACC_Percent: The winning percentage of the team in the ACC during the regular season.
columns.ACC_Home: The team's home record in the ACC, expressed in wins-losses format.
columns.ACC_Road: The team's road record in the ACC, expressed in wins-losses format.
columns.All_Games: The overall record of the team across all games, presented in wins-losses format.
columns.All_Games_Percent: The winning percentage of the team across all games.
columns.All_Home: The team's home record across all games, expressed in wins-losses format.
columns.All_Road: The team's road record across all games, expressed in wins-losses format.
columns.All_Neutral: The team's record in neutral site games, represented in wins-losses format.

basketball_match.table_description: The basketball_match table provides detailed statistics for each basketball team affiliated with a university, capturing performance metrics in various contexts such as conference play and overall competition.
